revised_title: Submillimetre Solar Radiation Detection at Sea Level
tldr: The authors detected submillimetre solar radiation at a sea-level site in London and discussed the suitability of various sites for submillimetre astronomical observations. They found that low temperature and low precipitable water-vapour content are crucial factors for selecting a suitable site. The study contributes to the understanding of submillimetre astronomy from ground-based observatories in different climates.
